page.title: 02Wild Life
page.content: The area is rich in wild life thanks to the abundance of food.Most of the hedges have been preserved and there are still many trees.Among the resident birds that are found in the area are wrens, sparrows,robins,blue tits,jackdaws, rooks,chaffinches,mag pies,herons,coots,water hens,grebes, kestrels,blackbirds,thrushes,jays, coal tits,wagtails,greenfinches,bull finches,pigeons,doves,crows,ducks, and many others.Among the migrants are swallows,house martins,swifts, lapwings,gulls,redwings,starlings and many more.Among the mammals are house and fieldmice,shrews,badgers,foxes, moles,voles,hedgehogs,rats,stoats, weasels,rabbits, hares and grey squirrels.The latter animals are not native to Britain and, unfortunately, they have replaced the native red squirrel and are they a pest.
